text: The arrondissement of Bourg-en-Bresse is an arrondissement of France in the Ain department in the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region. Its capital, and the prefecture of the department, is the city of Bourg-en-Bresse. ==History== When the Ain department was created on 1800, the arrondissement of Bourg-en-Bresse was part of that original department. ==Geography== It is found in the western half of the department with an area of , the largest arrondissement of the department. It is the arrondissement with more people living in it, with 354,177 inhabitants and a density of inhabitants/km². The arrondissement of Bourg-en-Bresse is bordered to the northwest by the Saône-et-Loire department, to the northeast by the Jura department, to the west by the arrondissements of Nantua and Belley, and to the southwest by the Rhône department. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Bourg-en-Bresse, there are 12 cantons whose communes are in the arrondissement: # Attignat (19 communes) # Bourg-en-Bresse-1 (1 commune and part of Bourg-en-Bresse) # Bourg-en-Bresse-2 (3 communes and part of Bourg-en- Bresse) # Ceyzériat (22 communes) # Châtillon-sur-Chalaronne (26 communes) # Meximieux (15 communes) # Miribel (8 communes) # Replonges (32 communes) # Saint-Étienne-du-Bois (28 communes) # Trévoux (12 communes) # Villars-les- Dombes (25 communes) # Vonnas (19 communes) The canton of Lagnieu has 22 communes in the arrondissement of Belley and 4 in the arrondissement of Bourg- en-Bresse; and the canton of Pont-d'Ain has 4 communes in Bourg-en-Bresse and 20 in the arrondissement of Nantua. ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Bourg-en-Bresse has 201 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes)ː #
